item.description:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 
 <title>Higgs.IO - Modern Networking library for the JVM</title>
 <link href="http://higgs.io/" rel="self"/>
 <link href="http://higgs.io"/>
 <updated>2014-04-12T15:38:35+01:00</updated>
 <id>http://higgs.io</id>
 <author>
   <name>Courtney Robinson</name>
   <email>higgs@crlog.info</email>
 </author>

 

 
 <entry>
   <title>Not found</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/404.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">

Sorry this page does not exist :(

Check out the other crap I've been doing for my research though...I'm sure there's something to peek your interest.

</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Archive</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/archive.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">





  

</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Atom Feed</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/atom.xml"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html"><?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 
 <title>{{ site.title }}</title>
 <link href="{{ site.production_url }}/{{ site.atom_path }}" rel="self"/>
 <link href="{{ site.production_url }}"/>
 <updated>{{ site.time | date_to_xmlschema }}</updated>
 <id>{{ site.production_url }}</id>
 <author>
   <name>{{ site.author.name }}</name>
   <email>{{ site.author.email }}</email>
 </author>

 {% for post in site.posts %}
 <entry>
   <title>{{ post.title }}</title>
   <link href="{{ site.production_url }}{{ post.url }}"/>
   <updated>{{ post.date | date_to_xmlschema }}</updated>
   <id>{{ site.production_url }}{{ post.id }}</id>
   <content type="html">{{ post.content | xml_escape }}</content>
 </entry>
 {% endfor %}

 {% for page in site.pages %}
 <entry>
   <title>{{ page.title }}</title>
   <link href="{{ site.production_url }}{{ page.url }}"/>
   <updated>{{ page.date }}</updated>
   <id>{{ site.production_url }}{{ page.id }}</id>
   <content type="html">{{ page.content | xml_escape }}</content>
 </entry>
 {% endfor %}
 
</feed></content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Bibliography</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/bibliography.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

{% bibliography %}</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Categories</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/categories.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

<ul class="tag_box inline">
  {% assign categories_list = site.categories %}
  {% include JB/categories_list %}
</ul>


{% for category in site.categories %} 
  <h2 id="{{ category[0] }}-ref">{{ category[0] | join: "/" }}</h2>
  <ul>
    {% assign pages_list = category[1] %}  
    {% include JB/pages_list %}
  </ul>
{% endfor %}

</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Core Higgs module</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/core.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

# Core module


</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Higgs Events</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/events.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

# Higgs Events


</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Higgs HTTP client</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/http-client.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

# HTTP client

</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Higgs HTTP, Single site server (S3)</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/http-server.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

# S3


</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Higgs.IO Documentation - Modern Networking on the JVM</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/index.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}


# What?

Higgs is a group of projects built on top of [Netty](http://netty.io).
These are all currently HTTP related but there is a plan to provide a binary protocol for RPC.

### Why

I'm not a fan of JSP, servlet containers or Apache's HTTP commons.
I like [Dropwizard](http://dropwizard.io) but it's too tightly coupled to Jetty's life-cycle.
I also like [Jersey](https://jersey.java.net/). That said, you can see my dilemma.
So Higgs takes the best of Dropwizard and Jersey to provide a framework to build REST web services on top of Netty.

## What's included?

1. [Core](/core.html)
2. [HTTP client](/http-client.html)
3. [HTTP server](/http-server.html)
4. [WebSocket client](/websocket-client.html)
5. [WebSocket server](/websocket-server.html)
6. [Event Dispatch library](/events.html)

# Pages

<ul>
  {% assign pages_list = site.pages %}
  {% include JB/pages_list %}
</ul>

## Categories

<ul>
  {% assign categories_list = site.categories %}
  {% include JB/categories_list %}
</ul>

## Posts
<div>
{% assign posts_collate = site.tags.homepage %}
{% include JB/posts_collate %}
</div>

## Tags

<ul>
  {% assign tags_list = site.tags %}
  {% include JB/tags_list %}
</ul>

## References

{% bibliography -c %}


Built with <a href="http://jekyllbootstrap.com" target="_blank">Jekyll Bootstrap</a> and <a href="http://github.com/dhulihan/hooligan" target="_blank">The Hooligan Theme</a>
</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>JSC Demo page</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/jsc.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

Mark down using cite {% cite pagh2005optimal %}, is new but invention x {% cite boom2 %} is awesome. Twas a creation of J's {% cite boom3 %} {% cite kirsch2006distance %}. Do you know what {% m %}e = mc^2{% em %} actually means? But do you really?

What about this ?

{% math %}
\mathbf{V}_1 \times \mathbf{V}_2 =  \begin{vmatrix}
\mathbf{i} & \mathbf{j} & \mathbf{k} \\
\frac{\partial X}{\partial u} &  \frac{\partial Y}{\partial u} & 0 \\
\frac{\partial X}{\partial v} &  \frac{\partial Y}{\partial v} & 0
\end{vmatrix} 
{% endmath %}

## References
{% bibliography -c %}</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Pages</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/pages.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

<h2>All Pages</h2>
<ul>
{% assign pages_list = site.pages %}
{% include JB/pages_list %}
</ul>
</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>RSS Feed</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/rss.xml"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html"><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<rss version="2.0">
<channel>
        <title>{{ site.title }}</title>
        <description>{{ site.title }} - {{ site.author.name }}</description>
        <link>{{ site.production_url }}{{ site.rss_path }}</link>
        <link>{{ site.production_url }}</link>
        <lastBuildDate>{{ site.time | date_to_xmlschema }}</lastBuildDate>
        <pubDate>{{ site.time | date_to_xmlschema }}</pubDate>
        <ttl>1800</ttl>

{% for post in site.posts %}
        <item>
                <title>{{ post.title }}</title>
                <description>{{ post.content | xml_escape }}</description>
                <link>{{ site.production_url }}{{ post.url }}</link>
                <guid>{{ site.production_url }}{{ post.id }}</guid>
                <pubDate>{{ post.date | date_to_xmlschema }}</pubDate>
        </item>
{% endfor %}


{% for page in site.pages %}
        <item>
                <title>{{ page.title }}</title>
                <description>{{ page.content | xml_escape }}</description>
                <link>{{ site.production_url }}{{ page.url }}</link>
                <guid>{{ site.production_url }}{{ page.id }}</guid>
                <pubDate>{{ page.date}}</pubDate>
        </item>
{% endfor %}

</channel>
</rss>
</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Sitemap</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/sitemap.txt"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% for page in site.pages %}
{{site.production_url}}{{ page.url }}{% endfor %}
{% for post in site.posts %}
{{site.production_url}}{{ post.url }}{% endfor %}</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Tags</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/tags.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

<ul class="tag_box inline">
  {% assign tags_list = site.tags %}  
  {% include JB/tags_list %}
</ul>


{% for tag in site.tags %} 
  <h2 id="{{ tag[0] }}-ref">{{ tag[0] }}</h2>
  <ul>
    {% assign pages_list = tag[1] %}  
    {% include JB/pages_list %}
  </ul>
{% endfor %}
</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Higgs WebSocket client</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/websocket-client.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

# WebSocket Client


</content>
 </entry>
 
 <entry>
   <title>Higgs WebSocket server</title>
   <link href="http://higgs.io/websocket-server.html"/>
   <updated></updated>
   <id>http://higgs.io</id>
   <content type="html">{% include JB/setup %}

# WebSocket Server


</content>
 </entry>
 
 
</feed>

item.title: Higgs.IO Documentation - Modern Networking on the JVM
item.description:
What?

Higgs is a group of projects built on top of Netty. These are all currently HTTP related but there is a plan to provide a binary protocol for RPC.

Why

I'm not a fan of JSP, servlet containers or Apache's HTTP commons. I like Dropwizard but it's too tightly coupled to Jetty's life-cycle. I also like Jersey. That said, you can see my dilemma. So Higgs takes the best of Dropwizard and Jersey to provide a framework to build REST web services on top of Netty.

What's included?

  1. Core
  2. HTTP client
  3. HTTP server
  4. WebSocket client
  5. WebSocket server
  6. Event Dispatch library
